=Decisive Williamite victory James flees to France |status = |combatant1 =
Soldiers loyal to James II |combatant2 = Dutch Republic |commander1 = Patrick
Sarsfield |commander2 = William III of Orange |units1 = |units2 = |strength1
=600, mostly Irish, soldiers |strength2 =250 Dutch soldiers Some people of
Reading |casualties1 =20â50+ |casualties2 =Few |notes = |campaignbox = }} The
'Battle of Reading' also known as the 'Battle of Broad Street' or 'The
Reading Skirmish' or 'The Reading Fight' took place on 9 December 1688 in
Reading, Berkshire. It was the only substantial military action in England
during the Glorious Revolution and ended in a decisive victory for forces loyal
to William of Orange. It was celebrated in Reading for hundreds of years
afterwards.
